As an AI language model, I do not have personal preferences or experiences. However, I can suggest some popular mindfulness exercises that many people find helpful:

1. Body scan: This exercise involves slowly scanning your body from head to toe, focusing on each part and any sensations you feel. 2. Breath awareness: Simply focusing on your breath and observing it as it flows in and out of your body. 3. Loving-kindness meditation: This involves cultivating feelings of love, kindness, and compassion towards yourself and others. 4. Walking meditation: Practicing mindfulness while walking, focusing on the sensations in your feet, legs, and body as you move. 5. Sensory awareness: Focusing on your senses, noticing what you see, hear, smell, taste, and feel in the present moment. 6. Gratitude practice: Taking time to reflect on what you are grateful for and focusing on the positive aspects of your life. Remember, the most important thing is to find an exercise or practice that resonates with you and supports your mindfulness journey. With consistent effort and practice, you can cultivate greater self-awareness, reduce stress, and improve your overall well-being.
